Recipe.Author: Bill & Cheryl Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A clone of the same cole slaw served at Top O The River restaurants.
Recipe.Instructions: Mix all ingredients together.[BR] Let set covered in the refrigerator for 1 hour.

Recipe.Author: Bill & Cheryl Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A spicy claussen type recipe using lactose fermentation. Pickles stay crisp and cruncy.
Recipe.Instructions: This should make near ¼ gallons (1 quart) of pickles. So just double it for half-gallon or quadruple it for a gallon. [BR] Put dill flower, peppers, and garlic in bottom of jar.[BR] Add the cukes, put sprigs of dill in center of cukes, add salt, vinegar, and fill jar with boiled water (that is now cooled/warm) to within 1/8th of top.[BR] Seal jar and shake to dissolve salt.[BR] Set upside down on counter away from sunlight and heat.[BR] Let sit 4-5 days flipping the jar either upright or upside down each day.[BR] Let sit upright 2 more days then refrigerate.[BR] Will lasts about +6 months refrigerated.[BR] NOTE: If brine becomes cloudy, this is normal.[BR] Just make sure the pickles don't smell spoiled and are not slimy.

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton
Recipe.Info: One of the best beef jerky marinades you will ever make. Used with thinly sliced London Broil or Eye of Round to create the perfect jerky.
Recipe.Instructions: Mix all ingredients together and marinade 1 - 2 lbs of sliced meat. Cover and refrigerated overnight. Dehydrate for 5-7 hours. Lawry’s Marinade and Dave's Sauce may be substituted for other marinade/hot-sauce. [BR] [BR] Replace the Lawry's with 12 oz of papaya juice for a sweet/spicy marinade.

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A clone of the same catfish batter used at Top O The River restaurants.
Recipe.Instructions: Mix all ingredients until all lumps are gone and batter raw, moist catfish fillets.[BR] Deep fry in peanut oil at 350° until done (5-10 minutes).

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A very tasteful and cruchy batter mix perfect for fried chicken fingers. Kids will love them.
Recipe.Instructions: Mix all ingredients well and batter raw chicken fillets.[BR] Dredge the battered fillets in flour.[BR] Deep fry in peanut oil at 350° until done (5-10 minutes).

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A clone of the same cornbread batter used at Top O The River restaurants.
Recipe.Instructions: Preheat over to 375°.[BR] Grease an 8 inch cast iron skillet.[BR] Combine all ingredients and blend well until few/no lumps.[BR] Pour batter into the prepared skillet.[BR] Bake in the oven for 30 to 40 minutes.[BR] Note: Pickled Jalapenos can be added for a Mexican style recipe.[BR]

Recipe.Instructions: Mix all ingredients together and marinade 1 - 2 lbs of sliced meat. Cover and refrigerated overnight. Dehydrate for 5-7 hours.

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton & Cheryl Hamilton
Recipe.Info: A clone of the same picked onions served at Top O The River restaurants.
Recipe.Instructions: Bring vinegar to a boil and remove from heat.[BR] Put onions and all other ingredients in a quart container.[BR] Fill container with hot vinegar to within 1/8 of the top.[BR] Seal, shake to desolve salt, and let set for 1 week before serving[BR]

Recipe.Author: Bill Hamilton & Cheryl Hamilton
Recipe.Info: This is a favorite of ours. We grow fresh tomotoes, onions, pepper, and basil in our garden just for this recipe.
Recipe.Instructions: Peel tomatoes and remove the seeds while straining to catch the juice into a bowl. Save the juice.[BR] In a food processor, combine all the ingredients and juice. Pulse quickly to blend. Pulse longer for smoother sauce.[BR] Transfer to a pot and bring to a boil. Low heat to simmer and allow the sauce to reduce to desire consitancy.[BR] Use immediately or can and process for later.
